channel.title: Virus
channel.description:
It come's to my attention that the octopus client with all 474 animation's has a .exe in it which is an octopus.exe, if you edit the run.bat you will realise it will say something like run octopus.exe.
What is an octopus.exe? Octopus is Flooder - spyware. You should remove it from your system as soon as possible.
Octopus description by publisher: Opens as many sockets with a remote host as made to be supported by both. It catches ^C & kill commands to shut down cleanly by closing all open connections before exiting. Often, a remote workstation made to be brought to its knees by saturating its process.
This Flooder is also known as: •DoS.Octopus - named by Kaspersky. • DoS/Octopus - named by Panda. • FDoS-Octopus - named by McAfee. • security risk or a "backdoor" program - named by F-Prot. • Win32/DOS.Octopus.18729!Trojan - named by Computer Associates.
Scan your comptuer to get rid of it, preferribly with avg.

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I’ve already locked and remove the content of both posts containing this. If you catch anymore of them, just simply report them again or send a moderator a PM.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

I deleted straight away, download it at your own risk.
Im sorry i did not report it to a modertor, but there are probly many pepole who are currently infected and need to know how to get rid of it, and this is why i’ve posted a site which can help.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

It come’s to my attention that the octopus client with all 474 animation’s has a .exe in it which is an octopus.exe, if you edit the run.bat you will realise it will say something like run octopus.exe.

What is an octopus.exe?
Octopus is Flooder - spyware.
You should remove it from your system as soon as possible.

Octopus description by publisher:
Opens as many sockets with a remote host as made to be supported by both. It catches ^C & kill commands to shut down cleanly by closing all open connections before exiting. Often, a remote workstation made to be brought to its knees by saturating its process.

This Flooder is also known as:
•DoS.Octopus - named by Kaspersky.
• DoS/Octopus - named by Panda.
• FDoS-Octopus - named by McAfee.
• security risk or a “backdoor” program - named by F-Prot.
• Win32/DOS.Octopus.18729!Trojan - named by Computer Associates.

Scan your comptuer to get rid of it, preferribly with avg.

Read full topic
